definitions.definition: To lie together snugly (with someone), in an intimate physical embrace; to snuggle .
examples: The young lovers cuddled on the couch.

definitions.definition: To embrace (someone) affectionately ; to hug (someone) closely.
To cradle (e.g. a baby) in one's arms so as to give comfort , warmth .
examples: She cuddled the infant before bedtime.
I'm cold; can you roll over here and cuddle me, honey?

definitions.definition: To lie close or snug ; to crouch ; to nestle .

main_definition: ( US , intransitive , transitive ) To lie together snugly (with someone), in an intimate physical embrace; to snuggle .
secondary_definitions: ( UK , intransitive , transitive ) To embrace (someone) affectionately ; to hug (someone) closely.
( transitive ) To cradle (e.g. a baby) in one's arms so as to give comfort , warmth .
To lie close or snug ; to crouch ; to nestle .
